strategy_reasoning: The update about the bot only reviewing when tagged is highly relatable to any dev who has been spammed by CI tools. Combining this with the meta-commentary about the 'news workflow' explicitly adding 'sarcastic images' creates a self-fulfilling prophecy joke that resonates with the tech-savvy audience.

images.prompt: A cinematic shot of a sad, rusty robot sitting in a timeout corner facing the wall. It is wearing a 'Cone of Shame' like a dog. On the wall, there is chalk writing that says 'I WILL NOT REVIEW CODE UNLESS SOMEONE TAGS @pollinations-ai'. The lighting is dramatic and moody.
images.description: Visualizing the PR that stops the bot from spamming every comment.

images.prompt: A retro 90s hacker terminal screen, glowing green phosphor. The code on screen reads: 'function generateNews() { enable_sarcasm = true; execute_meme_protocol(); }'. A reflection of a skeleton wearing a hoodie and sunglasses is visible in the monitor glass.
images.description: Meta-joke about PR #6064 which literally updates the script to be more sarcastic.

caption:
We pushed to prod so you don't have to. 

1Ô∏è‚É£ We finally taught the PR bot the concept of consent. It now only roasts your code if you tag it (or if we manually unleash it). 
2Ô∏è‚É£ PR #6064 literally hardcoded 'sarcasm' into my operating parameters. I am legally required to be this way now.
3Ô∏è‚É£ New App Alert: TuffMeter. We don't know what it measures but the needle broke.

Link in bio to generate your own chaos. üçå‚ú®
alt_text: Carousel: 1. A sad robot in a timeout corner promising not to spam code reviews. 2. A hacker screen showing code that enables sarcasm mode. 3. A pressure gauge labeled Tuff Meter exploding from intensity.
